description.description: An explanation, details, and more context about what this playbook does and tries to accomplish.

labels.description: Labels for this playbook (e.g., adversary persona names, associated groups, malware family/variant/name that this playbook is related to). Another option is to use MISP tags, taxonomies, and galaxies.

organization-type.description: The type of organization that the playbook is intended for. This can be an industry sector. Another option is to use MISP tags, taxonomies, and galaxies.

playbook-abstraction.description: The playbookâ€™s level of abstraction (with regards to consumption).

playbook-base64.description: The entire playbook file/document encoded in base64.

playbook-creation-time.description: The date and time at which the playbook was originally created.

playbook-creator.description: The entity that created the playbook. It can be a natural person or an organization. It may be represented using a unique identifier that identifies the creator.

playbook-file.description: The entire playbook file/document in its native format (e.g., CACAO JSON or BPMN).

playbook-id.description: A value that uniquely identifies the playbook.

playbook-impact.description: From 0 to 100, a value representing the impact the playbook has on the organization. A value of 0 means specifically undefined. Impact values range from 1, the lowest impact, to a value of 100, the highest. For example, a purely investigative playbook that is non-invasive could have a low impact value of 1. In contrast, a playbook that performs changes such as adding rules into a firewall should have a higher impact value.

playbook-modification-time.description: The date and time at which the playbook was last modified.

playbook-priority.description: From 0 to 100, a value representing the priority of this playbook relative to other defined playbooks. A value of 0 means specifically undefined. Priority values range from 1, the highest priority, to a value of 100, the lowest.

playbook-severity.description: From 0 to 100, a value representing the seriousness of the conditions that this playbook addresses. A value of 0 means specifically undefined. Severity values range from 1, the lowest severity, to a value of 100, the highest.

playbook-standard.description: The standard/format/notation the playbook conforms to (e.g., CACAO, BPMN).

playbook-type.description: The security-related functions the playbook supports. A playbook may account for multiple types (e.g., detection and investigation). The listed options are based on the CACAO standard and NIST SP 800-61 rev2. Another option is to use MISP tags, taxonomies, and galaxies.

playbook-valid-from.description: The date and time from which the playbook is considered valid and the steps that it contains can be executed.

playbook-valid-until.description: The date and time from which the playbook should no longer be considered a valid playbook to be executed.

revoked.description: A boolean that identifies if the playbook is no longer valid (revoked).

description: The security-playbook object provides meta-information and allows managing, storing, and sharing cybersecurity playbooks and orchestration workflows.
name: security-playbook
